result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ronald L McFarlane was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Count 1 OWI 5/6th.  Ct 2.  OWI BAC 5/6.

ADA Troy Cross appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant appeared in person with Atty Steven Cohen. Waiver to Right of Preliminary hearing filed.  Rights. Probable cause found, bound over for further proceedings.   Information filed.  Rights.  Plea Questionnaire rights and elements.  Guilty plea.  Adjudged guilty, JOC entered on Ct 1.  Ct 2 dismissed.   Joint Recommendation. Court withheld sentence and placed on 3 years probation.  Conditions:  12 months jail with huber commencing   4-17-2015 by noon.   $3268 fine to probation, 36 month revocation/36 month interlock/AODA and comply.  $250  DNA surcharge and submit sample.  Not to possess/consume alcohol.  $39 Blood Draw Reimbursement.  Jail credit: 2 days. Defendant  wants to serve Jail term for 9 months without huber.  Court imposed 12 months jail with huber.  Defendant can exercise huber or not.  Post conviction filed.   9:14 am/9:33 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ronald L McFarlane in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Cohen requesting argued plea/sentencing hearing in 60 days,  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant, Ronald L McFarlane, appeared by jail video, with Atty. Steve Cohen at the courthouse. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Attys. Cohen & Kohlwey. Warrant quashed. Bond continued. Return date kept on.
